conclusion: The car is entering from the right side of the image, moving leftward along the path indicated by the red arrow.
There are several colored blocks (yellow, blue, red, green, and orange) scattered across the table.
The car has some initial power (momentum) to move forward but will lose energy with each collision.
The blocks are stationary and relatively light, so the car can push smaller blocks or be deflected by larger stacks.
The surface is flat, so there’s no significant friction affecting the car’s motion unless specified.
The car’s size is roughly the same as the smaller blocks, based on the image.
The car enters from the right edge of the image.
The car’s straight-line path seems to align with the orange stack, red block, and blue stack.
Orange stack is a stack of two orange blocks.
Red block is a single red block slightly to the left of the orange stack.
Blue stack is a stack of three blue blocks further left, slightly above the red block.
The car likely has enough power to destabilize the orange stack and push the bottom block to the left.
After hitting the orange stack, the car continues moving left and hits the red block, likely pushing it to the left.
The car hits the blue stack and stops due to the stack’s mass and the car’s reduced momentum.
The car will most likely stop at the blue stack, as its momentum is depleted after three collisions.
The car will collide with the orange stack, the single red block, and the blue stack.
